LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Success_Label_Description: A mechanoid has successfully been hacked. It's targeting system now targets your enemy instead of your pawns.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Nothing_Description: Hacking failed but apart from some damage nothing serious happened
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_HackedPoorly_Description: While the mechanoid is hacked for now, the job isn't done well. Use this mechanoid at your own risk, or discard it
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_CausedMechanoidRaid_Descripti: One of your pawns somehow managed to activate a security mechanism that broadcasted a signal to nearby mechanoids. Prepare for more flesh machines...
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_ShotRandomDirection_Descripti: One of your pawns accidentally triggered the mechanoids main weapon. Whoops.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_HealedToStanding_Description: The mechanoid wasn't really disabled after all, while being hacked, it managed to recover and it is now your colony.
LanguageData.WTH_Letter_Mech_Reverted_Description: A mechanoid that was hacked poorly reverted to its original deadly behaviour.
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_Nothing_Description: Relative chance that nothing escalates when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_CauseRaid_Description: Relative chance that a raid is caused when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_ShootRandomDirection_D: Relative chance a mechanoid's main weapons fires in a random direction when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_HealToStanding_Descrip: Relative chance a mechanoid is healed until it can stand when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_FailureChance_HackPoorly_Description: Relative chance a mechanoid is hacked poorly when hacking fails
LanguageData.WTH_Menu_CarryToTable_Disabled: Carry to hacking table (no free table reachable)
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_PowerLow: Cannot enable mechanoid, power too low (disable auto-recharge to override this)
LanguageData.WTH_Reaon_PawnCannotBeDrafted: Cannot enable operate mechanoid controller belt when drafted
LanguageData.WTH_Reason_NotEnoughParts: Regenerating body parts costs {0} mechanoids parts per body part, not enough parts loaded to the platform to regenerate a single part
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_SearchAndDestroy_Description: Activate search and destroy mod. The mechanoid will automatically attack any enemies near your colony. When disabled, the mechanoid will return to a mechanoid platform when possible.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_AutoRecharge_Description: With this mode enabled, mechanoids automatically go back to a mechanoid platform when they have low power.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_RemoteControlActivate_Descript: Use the remote control device to control a mechanoid with a hacked locomotion system directly
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_RemoteControlDeactivate_Descri: Deactivates the remote control device, giving control back to the mechanoid
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Regenerate_Description: When this is active, the platform regenerates body parts of the mechanoid that are missing. Regenerating body parts consumes {0} mechanoid parts for each body part.
LanguageData.WTH_Gizmo_Repair_Description: When this is active, the platform repairs any mechanoid on the platform by activating its internal mechanites by providing enough power, and material to work with. The mechanites consume mechanoid parts stored in the platform in the process.
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_NotEnoughPlatforms_Description: You have more hacked mechanoids than mechanoid platforms in your main base. Make sure to make more mechanoid platforms
LanguageData.WTH_Alert_Power_Low_Description: The following mechanoids are low on power:{0} deactivate them so they go back to a mechanoid platform
LanguageData.WTH_FactionRestrictions_Label: Configure which mechanoids each faction can hack
LanguageData.WTH_FactionRestrictions_Description: This setting allows you to configure what hacked mechanoids each faction can use during raids
